name: Seam
headline: API for IoT Devices
description: Seam lets developers connect and control 3rd-party connected devices like door locks, thermostats, and more.

founders.name: Dawn Ho, Founder
founders.description: Everything Engineer. Formerly head of IoT at Sonder. Always hacking on something interesting, and generally passionate about the intersection of automation, design, and living spaces. Also have a law degree.

founders.name: Sy Bohy, Founder
founders.description: Stitching the interface to the physical world.

markdown:
raw_markdown='[](https://seam.co/) ##### Products ##### Developers ##### [Supported Devices](https://seam.co/)##### [Changelog](https://seam.co/) ##### [Contact Sales](https://seam.co/)##### [Sign In](https://seam.co/) Open menu #### API # Control Any IoT_ # Control Any IoT_ Use a single API and dashboard to unlock doors, set temperatures, grant temporary access to buildings, tap into camera feeds, and more. ##### [Get Started](https://seam.co/)##### [API Docs](https://seam.co/) ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27500%27%20height=%27625%27/%3e)![devices](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Findex%2Fcover-final.png&w=1080&q=75) ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27625%27%20height=%27375%27/%3e)![devices](https://seam.co) Compatible with ###### [30+](https://seam.co/) # Control Any Device From smartlocks and thermostats, to whole building access and energy systems, Seam supports multiple device & system categories. [![Image of various smart locks](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Findex%2Fbento%2Fsmartlock-bento-cover-2.png&w=3840&q=75)Smart LocksControl any smart lock with one API.](https://seam.co/) #### [Access SystemsOne API and mobile SDK to grant access to large buildings.](https://seam.co/) [![Nest Ecobee Tado thermostats](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Findex%2Fbento%2Fthermostats-bento-cover.png&w=3840&q=75)HVACSet temperature and climates to save energy.](https://seam.co/) [![Image of a Minut and Noiseaware sensor](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Findex%2Fbento%2Fsensors-bento-cover.png&w=3840&q=75)SensorsRead temperature, humidity, or noise level.](https://seam.co/) [![Connect system via Seam Bridge](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Findex%2Fbento%2Fvideo-bento-cover.png&w=3840&q=75)CamerasContact us for beta access.](https://seam.co/) Standardized API # One API to Hundreds of Devices Seam integrates hundreds of device types and puts them behind a standardized API. Spend your days building great products—not reading obscure protocol docs. ###### Compatible Brands: ###### [30+](https://seam.co/) ##### [See Compatible Devices](https://seam.co/) ``` 1importSeamfrom"seamapi"2 3// Automatically uses SEAM_API_KEY env var4const seam =newSeam()5 6// retrieve a lock and unlock it7const myLock =await seam.locks.get({name:"My Door"})8await seam.locks.unlockDoor(myLock)9 10// retrieve a thermostat and turn up the heat11const myThermostat =await seam.thermostats.get({12name:"My HVAC",13})14 15seam.thermostats.setTemperature({16device: myThermostat,17temperature:"20C",18})19 ``` ``` 1importSeamfrom"seamapi"2 3// Automatically uses SEAM_API_KEY env var4const seam =newSeam()5 6// retrieve a lock and unlock it7const myLock =await seam.locks.get({name:"My Door"})8await seam.locks.unlockDoor(myLock)9 10// retrieve a thermostat and turn up the heat11const myThermostat =await seam.thermostats.get({12name:"My HVAC",13})14 15seam.thermostats.setTemperature({16device: myThermostat,17temperature:"20C",18})19 ``` Easy as 1, 2, 3 # How Seam Works Connect accounts. Retrieve devices. Automate the world. [![Step 0 image](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Fhow-it-works%2Fseam-how-it-works-step-1-transparent.png&w=828&q=75)Link an AccountBegin by connecting a device accounts such as August or Igloohome.](https://seam.co/) [![Step 1 image](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Fhow-it-works%2Fseam-how-it-works-step-2-transparent.png&w=828&q=75)Retrieve DevicesOnce linked, you can retrieve all devices tied to this account.](https://seam.co/) [![Step 2 image](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Fhow-it-works%2Fseam-how-it-works-step-3-transparent.png&w=828&q=75)Issue CommandsCreate pin codes, unlock doors, read properties, and receive entry events.](https://seam.co/) Authorization # Link Any Account Seam's pre-built login flows guide your users to find and connect their devices with your application. ##### Prompt User Unlock doors across brands using a single API and SDKs ##### Select Manufacturer Set temporary and permanent access codes for your users ##### Enter Login Credentials Users use OAuth or their login credentials ##### Select Devices Users can then select which devices they want to connect to your app ##### [Read about Connect WebViews](https://seam.co/) * ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27300%27%20height=%27538.3333333333334%27/%3e)![Select Devices](https://seam.co) * ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27300%27%20height=%27538.3333333333334%27/%3e)![Initial disclosure screen](https://seam.co) * ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27300%27%20height=%27538.3333333333334%27/%3e)![Select Manufacturer](https://seam.co) * ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27300%27%20height=%27538.3333333333334%27/%3e)![Authorize App](https://seam.co) * ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27300%27%20height=%27538.3333333333334%27/%3e)![Select Devices](https://seam.co) * ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27300%27%20height=%27538.3333333333334%27/%3e)![Initial disclosure screen](https://seam.co) Device Categories # Connect Any Device From smartlocks and thermostats, to whole building access and energy systems, Seam supports multiple device & system categories. ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%2780%27%20height=%2780%27/%3e)![Image of a black smart lock](https://seam.co) ### Smart Locks Control brands like August, Igloohome, Yale, Kwikset, and more, using a single API to lock, unlock, and create access codes. [Smartlocks API](https://seam.co/) ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%2780%27%20height=%2780%27/%3e)![Image of a black intercom](https://seam.co) ### Intercoms & Access Systems Unlock lobby doors, issue credentials, edit resident directories, and more, across brands like Latch, 2N, Akuvox, and more. [Access Control Docs](https://seam.co/) ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%2780%27%20height=%2780%27/%3e)![Image of a black sensor](https://seam.co) ### Sensors Get temperature, humidity, or noise level, and receive webhook events on threshold crossing. [Sensor Docs](https://seam.co/) ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%2780%27%20height=%2780%27/%3e)![Image of a black thermostat](https://seam.co) ### Thermostats Beta Turn up the heat or keep it chill. Set schedules, adjust preferences, and much more, all using a single API. [Request Access](https://seam.co/) ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%2780%27%20height=%2780%27/%3e)![Image of a black camera](https://seam.co) ### Cameras Soon Tap into live feeds, receive events, and more. Contact us for early beta access. [Request Access](https://seam.co/) Unified Solution # Integrated Suite of Tools Seam provides APIs, client libraries, extensive documentation, and advanced dashboards to unify your device fleet operations. Build any workflow imaginable, set granular permissions across thousand person organizations, and much more. ### API & Client libraries ``` $ npm i seamapi ``` ``` $ pip install seamapi ``` ``` $ bundle add seamapi ``` ``` $ composer require seamapi/seam ``` ``` implementation 'io.github.seamapi:seam:0.x.x' ``` ``` $ cargo add seamapi-rs ``` ``` $ curl https://connect.getseam.com ``` Seam provides a set of APIs and client libraries that standardize common functions across device brands. This lets software developers implement any workflow imaginable. ### Operation Dashboards ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%271380%27%20height=%27884%27/%3e)![Seam Dashboard laptop](https://seam.co) The Seam Dashboard provides a unified interface that lets your Operation and Support teams work together to manage device fleets for a large number of locations. Seam provides a set of APIs and client libraries that standardize common functions across device brands. This lets software developers implement any workflow imaginable. The Seam Dashboard provides a unified interface that lets your Operation and Support teams work together to manage device fleets for a large number of locations. Components # Pre-built UI Components Seam provides a library of pre-built UI components to ship device UIs in minutes, not days. It handles securely retrieving device data and letting your application users issue device commands. [Learn More](https://seam.co/) ``` 1import{2SeamProvider,3ConnectAccountButton,4DeviceManager,5}from"@seamapi/react"6 7exportconstApp=()=>{8return(910
11

MyApp

121314
1516)17}18 ``` ``` 1import{2SeamProvider,3ConnectAccountButton,4DeviceManager,5}from"@seamapi/react"6 7exportconstApp=()=>{8return(910
11

MyApp

121314
1516)17}18 ``` ![Prebuilt component example](https://seam.co/_next/image?url=%2Fimg%2Fsmartlocks%2Fprebuild-example.png&w=1920&q=75) Sandbox # No Device, No Problem! With hundreds of device brands out there, it is not possible for you to own every device. This makes validating your code tricky. To solve this, Seam provides sandbox devices that accurately reproduce real device behavior. Use them to test your code, run CI, execute scenarios, and more. ##### [Learn about Sandbox Workspaces](https://seam.co/) ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27517%27%20height=%27418%27/%3e)![Seam Sandbox Illustration](https://seam.co) Seam Bridge # Need to Connect Offline Devices? Use the Seam Bridge to connect on-prem systems and avoid costly hardware replacements. Seam Bridge supports brands like DoorKing, Linear, RBH, and more. ##### [See Bridge](https://seam.co/) ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%271000%27%20height=%271000%27/%3e)![Seam web virtual key](https://seam.co) Let's Connect # Ready to get started? Explore our case studies or submit a request for consultation. You can also contact us if you have any specific question you want answered. ##### [Get Started](https://seam.co/)##### [API Docs](https://seam.co/) [](https://seam.co/) #### Products * ###### [API [Igloohome Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Kwikset Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Lockly Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Nuki Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Schlage Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [SmartThings Connected Locks](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Tedee Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [TTLocks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Wyze Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Yale Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) ##### Access Systems * ###### [ASSA ABLOY Visionline Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Avigilon Access Control Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [Brivo Access Control Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [ControlByWeb Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [4Suites Locks Guide](https://seam.co/) * ###### [PTI Security generated_description:
**Seam: Connecting the IoT Dots**

Founded in 2020 and hailing from the Y Combinator Batch S20, Seam is making waves in the internet of things (IoT) realm. Nestled in the innovation-hotbed of San Francisco, the company sports a lean team of 25 passionate individuals. Guided by Group Partner Gustaf Alstromer, Seam is not just another tech startup; it's redefining how developers interact with IoT devices.

### Mission Statement

Seam's mission is direct and clear: to provide a unified API for controlling various connected devices—everything from door locks and thermostats to camera feeds and access systems. They seek to simplify the chaos of device management, making it accessible for developers to create smart applications.

### What Seam Offers

At its core, Seam provides a standardized API that allows developers to connect an array of devices easily. The platform supports over 30 different device types, making it a versatile choice for anyone looking to harness the power of IoT. Want to unlock a door? Adjust the temperature? Seam’s API turns these tasks into a few simple code lines, sparing developers from wading through an ocean of obscure protocols.

Developers can dive into Seam's offerings through a clean, well-documented API and dashboard interface. The process is succinct—connect accounts, retrieve devices, and automate operations. Whether it’s managing smart locks, HVAC systems, or cameras, Seam provides the tools needed to integrate these functions seamlessly into applications.

### Key Features

1. **Unified API**: One API to control a myriad of connected devices.
2. **Easy Integration**: Pre-built UI components and extensive documentation shorten development time.
3. **Sandbox Testing**: Simulate device interactions without needing the physical devices.
4. **Seam Bridge**: Connects on-prem systems to avoid expensive hardware replacements.

### Conclusion

Seam is poised to take the hassle out of IoT device management for developers. Their platform simplifies connectivity and control over a wide range of devices, opening up new possibilities for innovation. If you're a developer or a business looking to enhance your IoT capabilities, Seam's streamlined API could be just what you need.

**Want to learn more or get started?** Check out their [website](https://seam.co) for all the details.
